Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Best approach for Unit testing asynch responses?


So said  Mike Clark  on  2002-11-14 

>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>>The meaning of "unit" in "unit test" is ambiguous, at best.  
>>>    
>>>
>>
>>What if we just tested "units of work that might break in important
ways"?
>>  
>>
>
>Nice definition, J.B.!  
>
>Now if only that's what we all thought when we heard "unit test".  The

>term unfortunately has baggage from testing days of yore.
>
>Perhaps an acronym will help: Unless Not Important, Test!

Brilliant! Let's make one of those little graphics and put them on our
web sites: the same kind as the "Runs on Any Browser" things. Almost
like a certification. "We UNIT test: Unless Not Important... Test!"

J. B. Rainsberger,
